title: Can you play music on Instagram live stream? Will I get copyrighted? - Quora

response.answer_text: Is the music your own original compositions ?!? You are not automatically copyrighted for ANYthing you create just by playing it on a social media platform. You must take certain amount of steps. If it’s music - it should be published with a time & date stamp - and sealed with any original hand-written documents, etc. Some people - rather than register songs with a publishing company like SOCAN - will have their songs transcribed, demo’ed on a cassette or CD - then mailed to themselves - double-registered - and never open the package when it arrives. However - you make “getting copyrighted” sound like you’re being penalised in some fashion. And it’s not a penalty. It’s a procedure to go through when you are trying to protect your intellectual property so that no one else can make money from it by claiming that it’s theirs.

Hi Sai, Are you aware that you can play music during Instagram Stories and you don’t have to be concerned about getting sued for copyright infringement? Instagram’s Story feature just recently added music. You pick from a selection of music. Instagram is offering you the music for free. No copyright concerns. The music even comes with lyrics for your viewers to sing along! I realized you asked about Instagram Live Stream. I don’t know, but I do know you can use Stories in the way I shared free of your concerns. For more indepth details about Instagram’s Story features, read this Instagram guide Instagram Online: 89 Instagram Secrets You Need to Know Janice

If you own the rights to it, then yes. But if you don't, no. If you play a song that you don't own the rights to on Instagram live you will get your live paused by Instagram with a message asking if you own the rights to the song with a notice that it's copyrighted material. When that happens, I usually just end my live and restart it without the music or with music that I own the rights to.

Please note that laws in different countries may vary. If someone appeal for copyrighted material and only then will the copied content be taken down on Instagram. Instagram has made it clear in it’s terms and conditions that, whatever you post on Instagram may be copied/Shared/used by anyone on Instagram. There was this case of photographer Sion Fullana’s images were shared on Spanish Vogue’s official Instagram. But they apologized!Here what you can do to post copyrighted music on Instagram. 1. ALWAYS GIVE CREDIT TO OWNERS!2. Appeal if you want to use the Music!3. Make slight changes to the music!4. Use Copyrighted Free Music for your Videos! Some websites that provide copyright-free music: audiojungle.net royaltyfreemusic.productions epidemicsound.com Go on! Use them!

You cannot use someone else’s content without permission. Doing so is illegal copyright infringement. That includes live streams. Will you get a copyright strike? Probably not until later when they turn the live stream into a recording. Only them will it be scanned to see if it has copyright protected music in it.

Maybe maybe not? Instagram live deletes after 24 hours so there's a limited window there to be caught. I suppose it's always possible. Instagram itself shouldn't flag you for it. Haven't heard of that before. It also disappears the next day. But always assume yes. If you question it probably safe to assume yes.

Most likely yes, and not just for stories but I’ve heard of them taking down posts which also contain copyrighted material. If possible, try and search for the music you wish to play and see if it can be added to the post? That could be one way around it.

As with the new legislation to protect artist rights, you have to put in a disclosure that “you don't own the rights” this will prevent any legal action against you. Thus keep your account from being blocked.
